thread.title: Alabama standout left tackle Cam Robinson 'battling a few injuries'
thread.title_full: Alabama standout left tackle Cam Robinson 'battling a few injuries'

author: Matt Zenitz | mzenitz@al.com
title: Alabama standout left tackle Cam Robinson 'battling a few injuries'
text:
Comments 
Two days after Alabama's win over Arkansas Oct. 10, Nick Saban said of left tackle Cam Robinson's performance during the game, "I don't think he would say or I would say that this last game was one of his best games." 
Robinson, Saban said, had been limited in practice during the week leading up, which affected the standout sophomore come game time. 
Though Robinson has played in all seven of the Tide's games, Robinson said following Alabama's win over Texas A&M Saturday night that he is "battling a few injuries." 
While Robinson helped clear the way for Derrick Henry to rush for a career-high 236 yards and two touchdowns Saturday, he struggled at times in pass protection against Aggies star defensive Myles Garrett. 
Garrett finished with five tackles, two stops for a loss, a sack, an additional quarterback hurry and a pass deflection. 
The injuries, Robinson said, are "no excuse." 
"I battled injuries last year," Robinson said. "It's nothing. It's just something I have to play through." 
Robinson has a history of being able to play through injuries. 
Robinson suffered a high ankle sprain against Tennessee last October. 
Saban thought Robinson may miss as much as a month. 
Robinson didn't miss a game. 
Following a bye week, he played against LSU, helping the Tide pull out a 20-13 overtime win. 
Robinson didn't miss any practices this summer after suffering a sprained knee. 
While limited, he was back participating the next day. 
"Some guys can deal with those types of things and it doesn't bother them," Saban said during the summer. "He seems to be one of those guys that doesn't complain much and really can manage the bumps and bruises that you get playing football. Everybody gets them, and some people can manage them and some people don't." Nick Saban post-game press conference (Texas A&M) Nick Saban spoke to the media after his team's 42-23 victory over Texas A&M about Derrick Henry, the status of his center, and what his halftime message was to the team.
